greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Filter sequence combining prime signature of n (A046523) and the cardinality of invphi (A014197).
comment: Restricted growth sequence transform of ordered pair [A046523(n), A014197(n)].
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
program: rgs_transform(invec) = { my(om = Map(), outvec = vector(length(invec)), u=1); for(i=1, length(invec), if(mapisdefined(om,invec[i]), my(pp = mapget(om, invec[i])); outvec[i] = outvec[pp] , mapput(om,invec[i],i); outvec[i] = u; u++ )); outvec; };

A014197(n, m=1) = { n==1 && return(1+(m<2)); my(p, q); sumdiv(n, d, if( d>=m && isprime(d+1), sum( i=0, valuation(q=n\d, p=d+1), A014197(q\p^i, p))))} \\ This function from _M. F. Hasler_, Oct 05 2009
A046523(n) = { my(f=vecsort(factor(n)[, 2], , 4), p); prod(i=1, #f, (p=nextprime(p+1))^f[i]); };  \\ From A046523
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 01 2018
